description: The graph shows the populations of the Canadian lynx (a predator) and the snowshoe hare, its main food source or prey, over the course of several decades.
feedback: The Canadian lynx is a predator and the snowshoe hare is its prey. The graph shows a connection between the population of snowshoe hares and the population of Canadian lynxes. A short time after the population of hares rises, the population of lynxes also begins to rise, since there is more abundant food (hares) to support more lynxes. This data illustrates a predator/prey relationship. As the number of prey increases, the population of predators also increases.
